key_points: Trump's mentions on social media have decreased by 91% since his ban from Twitter and Facebook.
The ban occurred in January following the Capitol riot by Trump supporters attempting to overturn the election results.
Twitter and Facebook banned Trump to prevent further incitement of violence.
Facebook's Oversight Board upheld the decision to suspend Trump, citing violation of rules and encouragement of violence.
Trump remains banned from both Twitter and Facebook.
Trump criticized Facebook's decision to uphold his ban, calling it a disgrace and an embarrassment to the country.
He argues that social media companies should pay a political price for their actions.
Trump has started a new personal blog to communicate directly with his followers, encouraging shares on Twitter and Facebook.
He previously communicated with subscribers and followers via email.
Trump adviser Jason Miller hinted at Trump returning to social media with his own platform, aiming to redefine the game.
